# Mini AI Project

This is a simple character-level Markov chain generator implemented in Python without using any external libraries like numpy, pandas, sklearn, torch, tensorflow, or requests. The project includes a command-line interface for training and generating text.

## Features
- Character-level Markov Chain Generator
- Command Line Interface (CLI) for training and generating text

## Installation
No installation required, just Python 3.7+

## Usage
```bash
python -m mini_ai.cli --help
train [TEXT]
generate [MODEL_FILE] [LENGTH]
```

## Contributing
Pull requests are welcome. For major changes, please open an issue first to discuss what you would like to change.

import unittest
from mini_ai.markov import MarkovChain, train

class TestMarkov(unittest.TestCase):
    def test_add_text(self):
        model = MarkovChain()
        text = 'hello world'
        train(model, text)
        self.assertEqual(model.chain, {'hello': ['world']})

    def test_generate_text(self):
        model = MarkovChain()
        text = 'one two three four five six seven eight nine ten eleven twelve thirteen fourteen fifteen'
        train(model, text)
        generated_text = model.generate_text(10)
        self.assertEqual(len(generated_text.split()), 10)

if __name__ == '__main__':
    unittest.main()
